Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Anklet
Description: Bracelet which was found around the right ankle of the deceased in a C-Group burial. It is composed of a multitude of disc-shaped beads, re-strung in a symmetrical pattern in modern times: black enamel beads or, in the middle section, two groups of beads of a bright blue enamelled paste.
